content: 2014 Titan Tenth 0.1BTC alloy "fyPcLJVM" PK versionFunded with face value: https://mempool.space/address/1Ped8aWqeKSvhN6AJT8ark5Tfyqw5gQGqK*Comes with COA*STARTING BID: 0.100BTCMINIMUM BID INCREMENT PER LOT: 0.001BTC**Please limit bids to ONLY 3 decimal places**END TIME: SEPTEMBER 21st, 2023, 14:00:00 PDT**Payment due within 24 hours of auction end!!**SNIPE: Any bid made in last 5 minutes will extend the auction 5 minutes beyond the ending time.If within those 5 extended minutes, a new bid is made, 5 minutes will be added to the auction from the time of that bid.PAYMENT: Bitcoin BTC. A signed PGP message will be sent to winner with payment addressSHIPPING: Based on location and preferenceOWNER: NOT DISCLOSED

comments.author: tldr-hodl
comments.body: I haven't followed that monstrosity of a thread on Titans...Can someone just confirm:1) There never was a real issue with this kind of PK Titan.2) Rest of the address is under the holo along with key, so it's easy to redeem.3) Without knowing the rest of the address you can't really check the loading though.Correct..?

comments.body: Quote from: tldr-hodl on September 16, 2023, 01:50:27 PMI haven't followed that monstrosity of a thread on Titans...Can someone just confirm:1) There never was a real issue with this kind of PK Titan.2) Rest of the address is under the holo along with key, so it's easy to redeem.3) Without knowing the rest of the address you can't really check the loading though.Correct..?1. No, not yet to the best of my knowledge.2. Yes (Usually, see next answer)?.3. Personally I'm confused on the funding here - Paper cert says for firstbits FyPcLJVM (No match on walletexplorer.com)? - Coin shows as fyPcLJVM (Also no match on walletexplorer.com)?  Also, scanning the coin brings me to dead page on titanbtc. We sure this is actually a PK, or did he fuck it up and it's really 2fA?  edit - if it's 2FA, it's only worth like what, .48 cents on the dollar? Fuckin' Tim Fillmore is a scumbag (sorry).

comments.body: Quote from: tldr-hodl on September 16, 2023, 01:50:27 PMI haven't followed that monstrosity of a thread on Titans...Can someone just confirm:1) There never was a real issue with this kind of PK Titan.2) Rest of the address is under the holo along with key, so it's easy to redeem.3) Without knowing the rest of the address you can't really check the loading though.Correct..?1) Correct2) No, these earlier made Titans used a code like the 2FA coins where you would enter it on the Titan website and it would display the regular bitcoin address¬†¬† ¬†Yes, there is a private key underneath the hologram...easy to redeem 3) Correct

So what now?Is there some database or mechanism to get the address from the "fyPcLJVM"?Or this code is not sufficient and you need some other info that's beneath the holo to get the address?Or is the PK itself somehow necessary to get the address?

So what now?Is there some database or mechanism to get the address from the "fyPcLJVM"?Or this code is not sufficient and you need some other info that's beneath the holo to get the address?Or is the PK itself somehow necessary to get the address?Personally I was unaware he made this version until MJ noted that, so it's "news" to me, or maybe i just don't remember, I was never really a fan, I have just watched the saga unfold and gotten sucked in somehow.  I would consider this a crapshoot unless it was peeled, because, no - there is no database available anymore - Tim lost btc at MTgox, and is currently paying out "verified holders" of 2FA coins at the rate of .48 per dollar, afaik.  MJ, jsut curious how many you have seen of these successfully peeled etc?

comments.body: Some PK versions were never funded. People keep getting this wrong. I believe once you verify the address however you can always tell if this was the case. Just an FYI.
